resources.string:
Know What To Eat
 How To Eat
 And
 When To Eat !!!
Be The Person\n You Want To Be
Make Yourself Fitter Everyday\n Set A Fitness Goal!
Track Your Performance\n With Each Meal!
Get Perfect Food Suggestions\n Just On A Click!
Get Perfect Food Suggestions\n Just On A Click

The light English Breakfast contains 
One fried egg,One link sausage,
 One slice Canadian bacon,One large slice bread,One cup beans. 
It Contains 850 calories, 40.4 g total fat, 
19.4 g carbohydrates and 43.4 g of protein.

The medium English Breakfast contains \Two fried egg,Two link sausage,
 Two slice Canadian bacon,Two large slice bread,One cup beans. 
It Contains 1000 calories, 60.4 g total fat, 
30.4 g carbohydrates and 60.4 g of protein.

The heavy English Breakfast contains \Three fried egg,Three link sausage,
 Three slice Canadian bacon,Three large slice bread,One cup beans. 
It Contains 1200 calories, 40.4 g total fat, 
43.4 g carbohydrates and 80.4 g of protein.

The light North Indian Breakfast contains 
One Aloo paratha,One cup curd,
 and 1 spoon butter. 
It Contains 350 calories, 30 g total fat, 
40 g carbohydrates and 20 g of protein.

The light North Indian Breakfast contains \One Aloo paratha,one cup curd,
 and one spoon butter and chai with buiscuits. 
It Contains 410 calories, 37 g total fat, 
65 g carbohydrates and 26 g of protein.

The light North Indian Breakfast contains \Two Aloo paratha,one cup curd,
 and one spoon butter and chai with buiscuits. 
It Contains 520 calories, 50 g total fat, 
70 g carbohydrates and 42 g of protein.

The light south indian Breakfast contains 
3 millet Idlis / 1 Dosa / 2 Medu Vada 
 1 small bowl sambar,and coconut chutney. 
It Contains 150 calories, 5 g total fat, 
30 g carbohydrates and 15 g of protein.

The medium south indian Breakfast contains 
8 millet Idlis / 3 Dosa / 5 Medu Vada / 2 uthappa of any type
 2 small bowl sambar,and coconut chutney. 
It Contains 300 calories, 10 g total fat, 
60 g carbohydrates and 30 g of protein.

The heavy south indian Breakfast contains 
8 millet Idlis / 3 Dosa / 5 Medu Vada / 2 uthappa of any type
 2 small bowl sambar,and coconut chutney. 
It Contains 475 calories, 17 g total fat, 
90 g carbohydrates and 45 g of protein.

The light Maharashtrian Breakfast contains \One plate poha or upma, sheera or Sabudana.
 
It Contains 250 calories, 20 g total fat, 
30.4 g carbohydrates and 10.4 g of protein.

The medium Maharashtrian Breakfast contains \Two plate poha or upma or sheera, Sabudana
 or one ThaliPeeth and chatani or courd.
 
It Contains 550 calories, 45 g total fat, 
59.4 g carbohydrates and 25.4 g of protein.

The heavy Maharashtrian Breakfast contains One plate poha or upma, sheera or Sabudana with
 Two ThaliPeeth and chatani or courd.
 
It Contains 675 calories, 60 g total fat, 
71.8 g carbohydrates and 35.9 g of protein.

The light Common Breakfast contains 
One cup tea/ coffee or milk 
 ,buiscuits or big cup of oats. 
It Contains 300 calories, 20 g total fat, 
45 g carbohydrates and 10 g of protein.

The medium Common Breakfast contains 
One cup tea/ coffee or milk 
 with small bowl of oatmeal
 or poha with sambar and upma. 
It Contains 400 calories, 29 g total fat, \71 g carbohydrates and 22 g of protein.

The heavy Common Breakfast contains 
One cup tea/ coffee or milk 
 with large bowl of oatmeal
 or poha with sambar and upma. 
It Contains 500 calories, 40 g total fat, \100 g carbohydrates and 35 g of protein.
